description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Achieve measurable improvement in accuracy and reasoning for both Math and Reading & Writing by reducing careless errors and reinforcing partially mastered skills. Demonstrate increased cognitive flexibility under moderate time pressure through strategic practice. Establish a consistent pattern of performance review cycles to analyze mistakes, adapt strategies, and retest with improved precision. Progress steadily toward bridging the gap from 1190 to 1590 by embracing incremental challenges that push beyond comfort zones without disrupting emotional balance.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Central Ideas and Details, Command of Evidence - Textual, Inferences

description.title: Math
description.description: Right triangles and trigonometry, Percentages, Area and volume, One-variable data: Distributions and measures of center and spread, Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

description.Central Ideas and Details: Engage with medium-difficulty passages by summarizing central ideas in your own words after timed readings, then answer targeted questions to identify patterns in your understanding and common errors, fostering deliberate reflection on core concepts without pressure.
description.Command of Evidence - Textual: Practice challenging evidence-based questions by annotating passages to locate textual support under timed conditions, then explain your reasoning aloud or in writing to reinforce advanced comprehension and build confidence in handling complex texts.
description.Inferences: Work through advanced inference problems by creating hypothesis-driven notes on implied meanings before answering, gradually increasing difficulty and timing to develop nuanced reasoning while maintaining calm and thoughtful engagement.

description.Right triangles and trigonometry: Solve sets of basic to moderate right triangle problems by first drawing detailed diagrams labeling opposite, adjacent, and hypotenuse sides, then apply sine, cosine, and tangent ratios with calculator use, focusing on accuracy and avoiding common side confusion under moderate time constraints.
description.Percentages: Complete medium-difficulty percentage problems involving conversions, increases, decreases, and word problems by writing out each step clearly and estimating answers before final calculation to reduce errors and build fluency with real-world contexts.
description.Area and volume: Tackle the most challenging area and volume problems by breaking composite figures into simpler shapes, calculating stepwise under timed conditions, and verifying units and formulas meticulously to improve speed and precision.
description.One-variable data: Distributions and mea: Analyze medium-level data sets by calculating mean, median, range, and IQR manually, then interpret graphical representations such as box plots and histograms to identify shape and outliers, reinforcing conceptual understanding through applied practice.
description.Ratios, rates, proportional relationship: Master complex ratio and proportion problems by setting up and solving multi-step equations with unit conversions, writing all units explicitly, and practicing under timed conditions to enhance accuracy and speed while maintaining composure.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday balances conceptual mastery and strategic practice by pairing one Math skill with one Reading & Writing skill, starting the week with weakest areas to build foundational strength, progressing midweek to moderate skills for reinforcement, and dedicating Fridays to comprehensive review and error analysis. Saturdays focus on one full-length timed practice test followed by detailed answer review to identify patterns and adapt strategies. Sundays serve as a Flex Day to support rest, reflection, and flexible engagement aligned with personal well-being.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in low-pressure reflection by reviewing errors from the week and journaling insights on when to push beyond comfort versus maintaining balance. Experiment with new study tools or techniques such as digital flashcards or timed mini-quizzes to gamify learning gently. Participate in mixed-skill challenges with peers slightly more intense to stimulate motivation without overwhelming. Incorporate mindfulness or light physical activity like walking or yoga to sustain emotional stability. Set clear, achievable goals for the upcoming week to maintain steady, sustainable progress.
